title: Taylor Swift confirmed to perform at Alibaba's 11.11 Countdown Gala in China next month
text:
Taylor Swift will be heading to the Middle Kingdom to kick off the biggest shopping event in the world next month.

The 29 year old singer has been confirmed to perform at Alibaba’s 11.11 Countdown Gala at Shanghai's Mercedes-Benz Arena on November 10, per Alizila.

Swift will be joined by a number of Chinese performers such as G.E.M., Hua Chenyu, Kana Hanazawa, Ju Jingyi, Li Ronghao, Luo Yunxi, Jackson Yee, Zhang Jie and Zhang Yixing.

Taylor in China: The 29 year old singer has been confirmed to perform at Alibaba’s 11.11 Countdown Gala at Shanghai's Mercedes-Benz Arena on November 10, per Alizila

The singer is just as big in China as she is in the United States, with her new album Lover topping more than 1 million in album equivalent sales in its first week.

The album was the most-consumed international album ever, in terms of both sales and streaming.

Other celebrities that have shown up for the event include Nicole Kidman, Scarlett Johansson, Mariah Carey and athletes like David Beckham, Maria Sharapova and Kobe Bryant, though that may change this year.

Big hit: The singer is just as big in China as she is in the United States, with her new album Lover topping more than 1 million in album equivalent sales in its first week

The news of Swift's confirmation comes as the Chinese government has come under fire over the country banning South Park following an episode that was critical of Chinese policy and controversy over an NBA general manager tweeting support for China.

While Alibaba has confirmed Swift and the aforementioned Chinese stars, they add the full lineup will be released closer to the event, which coincides with the event on Single's Day on November 11 (11/11), created as an alternative to Valentine's Day.

The live show leads up to the biggest shopping day in the world, with over 500 million people expected to participate this year.

Last year, over 400 million people took part in Alibaba's 11.11, with a whopping $30.8 billion in gross merchandising volume over the 24-hour sale, eclipsing America's Black Friday and Cyber Monday combined ($24.2 billion).

Celebs: Other celebrities that have shown up for the event include Nicole Kidman, Scarlett Johansson, Mariah Carey and athletes like David Beckham, Maria Sharapova and Kobe Bryant

The show could very well serve as a tuneup as Swift gets ready to hit the road in 2020 in support of her Lover album.

Swift will kick off her Lover Fest tour on June 20, 2020 at Werchter Festivalpark in Werchter, Belgium, with performances in Berlin, Oslo, Lisbon and Madrid over the next few weeks.

She will also become the first female artist ever to open an NFL stadium when she performs at the brand new SoFi Stadium on July 25 and 26 2020.

Hit the road: The show could very well serve as a tuneup as Swift gets ready to hit the road in 2020 in support of her Lover album

Taylor Swift recently was featured as a guest mentor on NBC's hit reality series The Voice on Monday's new episode.

She will also return to the big screen for her starring role as Bombalurina in Universal Pictures' big-screen adaptation of the long-running Broadway classic Cats.

Swift stars alongside Idris Elba, Rebel Wilson, Ian McKellen, Judi Dench, Jason Derulo and Jennifer Hudson in Cats, arriving in theaters Christmas Day.

Mentor: Taylor Swift recently was featured as a guest mentor on NBC's hit reality series The Voice on Monday's new episode
description: Taylor Swift will be heading to the Middle Kingdom to kick off the biggest shopping event in the world next month.
